title: Feel so bad for Bjergsen, his team is so incompetent compared to him.
body: Dyrus is overrated and needs to do his team a service and allow a new top laner to come on the team.

I think the Dyrus criticism is partially legit. He gets caught out A LOT. But also, the whole team often leaves him out to dry.

Santorin isn't going anywhere. He is a support jungler. Which is exactly what TSM needs.

Dyrus is always fapping around away from the team, and teleports in late as hell or he goes and solo engages and gets wrecked. Not to mention he always dies top, he almost never lanes without dying. He's more done than burnt barbecue.

What i saw was just 5 solo queuers winning their lanes and just "solo queuing" the rest of the game with no direction as how to end the game.

I really wonder if TSM needs a new coach and analysts.

TSM always seems to pick bad, or fail to ban out champs the opponent is good with lately.

In that Game Bjerg almost had double the champ damage of turtle and dyrus, and triple the champ damage of Santorin and Lustboy. It does not make sense, Rek'sai is a early-mid game champ, and meteos didn't counter jungle Santorin much, Santorin should have double the champ damage he does

oh well, they didn´t really fight early to mid, and lategae rek´sai can´t do that much in an actual fight, especially vs a comp with srong dmg+strong peel like C9 had. So no, not much chances for him to deal dmg to Champs that game...not saying he played particularly well, but it´s mostly the fault of whoever made the calls. They should have went a lot more aggressive midgame with their comp (instead of letting C9 take 3 turrets for free while being ahead \*cough*).
Not really his shoutcalling sucks.  Make lustboy learn English and make him be shoutcaller he is the best on the team.
....You do know they won last split with this same team right?
Yes, they won the joke region split, then failed miserably on the real stage.  We know, we know.

The problem with TSM is that they really only have one strategy to win and other teams have figured that out now. They need a new coach and philosophy. There is no reason they shouldn't be competing for the world title with the resources they have. Dyrus is a bit overrated, but he is still a good player. He just needs to be more flexible so they can run different team comps and implement new strategies.

If they don't do these things, put a fork in TSM, they are done.

You know what's funny? Even with that "one strategy" they will probably be in LCS Finals. And they are likely still going to worlds.

As much as I hate to say this, NA talent is extremely lacking so the subpar TSM play will likely still win against even more subpar NA teams. TSM is the SK Gaming of NA. Sad really.

I am in no way a TSM fanboy, or any other team for that matter, but honestly put a fork in NA LCS and most of EU LCS (Fnatic looked awesome at MSI if they can continue they are the only hope for the west at worlds unless other EU teams can step up).

I agree with you. NA just doesn't have the talent right now to compete internationally. TSM's gameplan works great for NA, but will never win Worlds. 

I do think Fnatic has a good chance this year. The did great at MSI and they haven't even reached their peak yet.

I think Santorin is the real weakness in TSM.  Dyrus isn't anything special, but Santorin is like the zoolander for top lane.  He just can't go there, ever, for any reason.  He has to stay on the bottom side of the map.  Herp derp, guess half his mini map is broken.
It isn't TSM, it is the whole NA. Don't expect them to win when the NA community is centered around language and not gameplay.

can´t blame a single player though, they just picked a horrible comp altogether...they had absolutly no backline-threat vs a kogmaw, and nothing to reliably destroy the frontline either. They just have to stop focusing too much on picks like maokai and urgot as a team, because they have clear weaknesses that easily get abused - e.g. by a comp such as C9s. 
The Victor pick also pretty much had been win lane - lose game. Bjergsen is as much at fault as everyone else on the team (+ Dyrus really looks improved compared to MSI, he really played a lot saver and still got the CS lead early on).
